intro: Daviesia decurrens, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daviesia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pinkish to reddish flowers that bloom in spring. It is often found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Daviesia decurrens is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
